title: The 'Phone Booth' Workout
author: adam-harrington
description: Elite ball handling in 4 square feet. This workout proves you don't need a gym—you need discipline. Every move happens in place.
coachNote: Adam's Take: I've trained guys in hotel rooms smaller than your closet. Space is an excuse. This workout strips away movement and forces pure handle. If you can control the ball in a phone booth, you can control it anywhere.

steps.title: Stationary Pounds
steps.instruction: Stand in one spot. Pound the ball as hard as possible while keeping it below knee height. Control the chaos.

steps.title: In-and-Out (No Movement)
steps.instruction: In-and-out crossover without moving your feet. Ball goes outside your knee, then back between your legs. Rhythm is key.

steps.title: Between-the-Legs Combos
steps.instruction: Alternate between-the-legs dribbles. Right hand front, left hand back. Then reverse. Stay planted.

steps.title: Behind-the-Back Wraps
steps.instruction: Continuous behind-the-back dribbles. The ball should 'kiss' the ground behind you and return to your front hand.

steps.title: Spider Dribble
steps.instruction: Ball bounces once in front, once in back, switching hands each time. Like a spider crawling. This is the ultimate stationary handle drill.

steps.title: Freestyle Combo (Silent)
steps.instruction: Combine all moves above in any order. Keep the ball below your waist. Minimal noise. Maximum control.

coachingCues: Your feet should not move from their starting position
Keep eyes up—don't watch the ball
Control > Speed until you master the pattern
If you're making noise, you're losing control
commonMistake: Drifting out of the 'phone booth' zone
mistakeFix: Put tape on the floor marking your 2x2 foot zone. Stay inside it.
